content: When first setting up an account, Thunderbird offers either POP or IMAP. If that isn't correct, just change it prior to filling in the rest of account information. If you're sure all the information is correct, omit the password during setup, as that at least allows Thunderbird to validate the proper connections to servers.
creator: davidsk

content:
I have search the forums and done everything i could find that seemed to address this problem, including the somewhat outdated mozilla guide. No luck. Cookies are turned on and everything :)

Thunderbird worked on my old computer a few days ago, so I don't think it's anything related to the gmail-account. Let me know if I can provide any other info that would help diagnose this error.

Thanks
creator: johansdatormail

content: Try this: - click 'new message' button - now click view>toolbars and tick 'composition toolbar' (if you do not see the 'view' option, press the Alt key and menu bar will appear.

content: For anyone reading this, I have finally resolved the issue. Rather than clicking on the hamburger icon, whilst highlighting the appropriate inbox, click on view/sort by/ and changed threaded to unthreaded. I still don't understand why Tbird randomly changed the settings, which I have had for years, but at least at the moment, it is undoable!
creator: sminns

content: Try this: - click 'new message' icon' - click view>toolbar and tick the composition toolbar if view option is not viewable, click alt key to display menu bar first
creator: davidsk

content: Da quel che so, si può fare con qualsiasi carta di credito o tramite Paypal. Basta andare in questa pagina -> https://www.thunderbird.net/it/donate/ scegliere l'importo da donare e fare click su Dona e sostieni. Nella finestra successiva si possono scegliere vari metodi di pagamento tra cui anche la carta di credito.

content: Could you post a screenshot? I've never seen it missing. However, if you rightclick on unified toolbar, I think you can add a 'write' button to it.
creator: davidsk

content: This can sometimes happen if TB is interrupted by such as an antivirus program. This may work: - exit TB' - in File Explorer, rename the original to something else (just to ensure it isn't lost) - remove the -2 from the other and restart TB - if all is okay, you can delete item you renamed
creator: davidsk

content: To stop the autofilling, click settings>composition and UNtick the box to 'automatically add outgoing email addresses'
creator: davidsk

content:

See attached screen shot. I would like my email to only be affiliated with my name..

content: I wasn't aware that Thunderbird for Android had been released yet. Generally speaking, your Android email app should use the same settings as you use on your laptop.
creator: davidsk

content:
This is sometimes problematic, but should normally work: Exit Thunderbird if running. 

   click windows key and 'r' key    Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade    click on 'OK'

Personally, I do not recommend it, as the prior version will no longer be supported and you will eventually need to upgrade for continued support.
creator: davidsk

content: Please provide more information, such as whether the account is POP or IMAP, your desired host address and the wrong one being used. Thank you.

content: Settings/General/Incoming Mails, App Icon Options, select Count of unread messages.
